answers.answer: I work in a lab! The answer is no! Sorry :/ when we have a patient throw up we need to cancel the test. When a patient faints or feels really gross with out throwing up we have them lie in a room and we come to them to draw blood. From what i've seen and experienced, the patient will retest in a diiferent way or the dr will use what numbers we have available and Dx you. Sorry! Hopefully I'm wrong and you passed! Gd is no fun :/
Thanks for your response! I have a family history of diabetes but I was hoping to avoid GD since in only 26 years old, pysically fit, and eat healthy but I guess genetics trumps all that.
I did. Felt faint and sick but didn't vomit until after the test was over and I passed no problem.  Good luck!

I felt nauseous this time around and unfortunately didn't pass. But honestly is not that bad. I cried when I found out,  but I also know I did nothing wrong.  Alot of my family members have diabtetes and doc said that is most likely the reason I got it.  I just have to test m blood 4 times a day and stick to a special diet(which isn't bad at all. I'm eating the same things I've always eaten just making sure I add snacks and limit sugar intake)  I go to a high risk team of docs, dieticians and nutritionist once a week and need an ultrasound monthly. As of right now no meds and I cant wait for my little one to be born so this can disappear and the worries can lessen.

question: Has anyone fainted and felt sick during the 3 hr glucose test and still passed or am I definately going to fail?
title: faint and feel sick and still pass glucose test?
